page.title: 14East Clevedon to Court Hill2
page.content: The most remarkable thing about Queen Anne Cottage is that it has no mains services at all.No mains gas, water, electricity or sewerage.Lighting in the cottage is by candle or oil_lamp. A well supplies the water and a septic tank removes the sewerage.There is a telephone connection with the outside world. The next stop on our walk was "Keeper's Cottage".This small home set deep in the wood looks rather like the gingerbread cottage from "Hansel and Gretel".It was one of the gamekeeper's cottages on the edge of the Clevedon Court estate.The present owner is a lady in her 80's(the widow of a game_ keeper). The last part of our walk took us to Court Hill and the bridge over the M5.
